item.title: Just Enough Software Architecture: Chapter 3
item.description: This series loosely summarizes George Fairbanks’s Just Enough Software Architecture: A Risk-Driven Approach as I read through it. Chapter 3 of Just Enough Software Architecture details the how of the risk-driven model. How should it be applied? What techniques should be used? Are You Risk-Driven? Some teams think they’re already risk-driven when they’re not. How can you know for sure? Look at your processes. Do you have rigid rules?

item.title: Switching From Windows to Ubuntu as My Daily Driver
item.description: About a week ago, I started using Ubuntu as my daily driver instead of Windows. This post explains why and (partially) documents my setup … mostly to jog my memory when I forget half of what I did, but hopefully someone else considering a similar setup will benefit too. Why Not Windows 10? I like Windows. PowerShell is a fantastic abstraction of .NET, and now that it’s cross platform, I’ll be using it on Linux too.
